Residential_level_2_rebate: Up to $2,000 for a Level 2 home charger installation
Residential_summary: The Clean Cars for All program offers eligible residents a rebate of up to $2,000 for a Level 2 home charger installation and up to $600 for a Level 2 portable charger.

Program_name: SLO County APCD Alt Fuel Infrastructure Grant Program
Commercial_summary: 60% of infrastructure and installation costs for Level 2 and DC fast chargers

Residential_level_2_eligibility: Purchase a Level 2 electric vehicle charger (optional accessories are not eligible for this incentive; adapters and splitters may be allowed in conjunction with the purchase of a charger but the total reimbursement can not exceed $300)
Residential_summary: The program provides up to $300 for the purchase of a Level 2 electric vehicle charger for your home.

Commercial_level_2_eligibility: El Dorado County businesses installing Level 2 EVSE in publicly accessible parking lots
Commercial_summary: El Dorado County businesses can receive up to $5,000 per charger (per plug-in) for installing Level 2 EVSE in publicly accessible parking lots.
Residential_level_2_eligibility: Purchase of a Level 2 electric vehicle charger for your home
Residential_summary: Residents can receive up to $300 for purchasing a Level 2 electric vehicle charger for their home.

Program_name: Residential Electric Vehicle (EV) Charging Incentive Program
Residential_level_2_eligibility: Must be hard-wired, installed by a licensed electrician, and meet UL standards.
Residential_summary: The program offers rebates for hard-wired Level 2 EV chargers installed by a licensed electrician in the South Coast AQMD’s four-county jurisdiction. The program is administered on a first-come, first-served basis and provides up to a $250 rebate or the cost paid for the charger, whichever is lower.

Commercial_summary: $1,000 per Level 1 charger, $2,000 per Level 2 charger or $5,000 per DC fast charger.

Program_name: Residential Electric Vehicle (EV) Charging Incentive Program
Residential_level_2_eligibility: The charger must be hard-wired, UL listed or certified by an equivalent nationally recognized laboratory, installed by a licensed electrician, and meet city electrical permit requirements.
Residential_summary: The program provides rebates for hard-wired Level 2 EV chargers installed in residential properties within the South Coast AQMD's jurisdiction.
